noun.description: The action of lashing out; an instance of this.

verb.description: To lash out; to strike out violently. In earliest use figurative: to break out into excess; to be extravagant, exaggerate. Compare "overlash". Now rare.

origin: Mid 19th century. From out- + lash, after to lash out<br>late Middle English (in an earlier sense). From out- + lash.
